alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 06 at 3:58PM MDT until July 06 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Johnson County in north central Wyoming... * Until 445 PM MDT. * At 357 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 15 miles northwest of Fort Reno Historical Site, which is also 22 miles northeast of Kaycee, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * Locations impacted include... Fort Reno Historical Site. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
